name: geometry
description: The shape of the visual or collision object.

children.name: empty
children.description: You can use the empty tag to make empty geometries.

children.name: box
children.description: Box shape

children.name: size
children.description: The three side lengths of the box. The origin of the box is in its geometric center (inside the center of the box).

children.name: capsule
children.description: Capsule shape

children.name: radius
children.description: Radius of the capsule

children.name: length
children.description: Length of the cylindrical portion of the capsule along the z axis

children.name: cone
children.description: Cone shape

children.name: radius
children.description: Radius of the cone

children.name: length
children.description: Length of the cone along the z axis

children.name: cylinder
children.description: Cylinder shape

children.name: radius
children.description: Radius of the cylinder

children.name: length
children.description: Length of the cylinder along the z axis

children.name: ellipsoid
children.description: Ellipsoid shape

children.name: radii
children.description: The three radii of the ellipsoid. The origin of the ellipsoid is in its geometric center (inside the center of the ellipsoid).

children.name: heightmap
children.description: A heightmap based on a 2d grayscale image.

children.name: uri
children.description: URI to a grayscale image file

children.name: size
children.description: The size of the heightmap in world units. When loading an image: "size" is used if present, otherwise defaults to 1x1x1. When loading a DEM: "size" is used if present, otherwise defaults to true size of DEM.

children.name: pos
children.description: A position offset.

children.name: texture
children.description: The heightmap can contain multiple textures. The order of the texture matters. The first texture will appear at the lowest height, and the last texture at the highest height. Use blend to control the height thresholds and fade between textures.

children.name: size
children.description: Size of the applied texture in meters.

children.name: diffuse
children.description: Diffuse texture image filename

children.name: normal
children.description: Normalmap texture image filename

children.name: blend
children.description: The blend tag controls how two adjacent textures are mixed. The number of blend elements should equal one less than the number of textures.

children.name: min_height
children.description: Min height of a blend layer

children.name: fade_dist
children.description: Distance over which the blend occurs

children.name: use_terrain_paging
children.description: Set if the rendering engine will use terrain paging

children.name: sampling
children.description: Samples per heightmap datum. For rasterized heightmaps, this indicates the number of samples to take per pixel. Using a higher value, e.g. 2, will generally improve the quality of the heightmap but lower performance.

children.name: image
children.description: Extrude a set of boxes from a grayscale image.

children.name: uri
children.description: URI of the grayscale image file

children.name: scale
children.description: Scaling factor applied to the image

children.name: threshold
children.description: Grayscale threshold

children.name: height
children.description: Height of the extruded boxes

children.name: granularity
children.description: The amount of error in the model

children.name: mesh
children.description: Mesh shape

children.name: optimization
children.description: Set whether to optimize the mesh using one of the specified methods. Values include: "convex_hull" - a single convex hull that encapsulates the mesh, "convex_decomposition" - decompose the mesh into multiple convex hull meshes. Default value is an empty string which means no mesh optimization.

children.name: convex_decomposition
children.description: Convex decomposition parameters. Applicable if the mesh optimization attribute is set to convex_decomposition

children.name: max_convex_hulls
children.description: Maximum number of convex hulls to decompose into. This sets the maximum number of submeshes that the final decomposed mesh will contain.

children.name: voxel_resolution
children.description: The number of voxels to use for representing the source mesh before decomposition. Applicable only to voxel based convex decomposition methods.

children.name: uri
children.description: Mesh uri

children.name: submesh
children.description: Use a named submesh. The submesh must exist in the mesh specified by the uri

children.name: name
children.description: Name of the submesh within the parent mesh

children.name: center
children.description: Set to true to center the vertices of the submesh at 0,0,0. This will effectively remove any transformations on the submesh before the poses from parent links and models are applied.

children.name: scale
children.description: Scaling factor applied to the mesh

children.name: plane
children.description: Plane shape

children.name: normal
children.description: Normal direction for the plane. When a Plane is used as a geometry for a Visual or Collision object, then the normal is specified in the Visual or Collision frame, respectively.

children.name: size
children.description: Length of each side of the plane. Note that this property is meaningful only for visualizing the Plane, i.e., when the Plane is used as a geometry for a Visual object. The Plane has infinite size when used as a geometry for a Collision object.

children.name: polyline
children.description: Defines an extruded polyline shape

children.name: point
children.description: A series of points that define the path of the polyline.

children.name: height
children.description: Height of the polyline

children.name: sphere
children.description: Sphere shape

children.name: radius
children.description: radius of the sphere
